intro: Piper anisotis, commonly known as the Mexican pepper plant or wild betel, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Piper genus in the family Piperaceae, which includes many species used for their aromatic and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that develop into elongated, woody fruits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional uses. The leaves are sometimes used in herbal remedies and as a spice in local cuisines.
